question: Question_01_(b)
sols:
Since the numerator, $g(x),$ approaches 6 as $x\to\infty,$ the
denominator must approach 2 in order for the fraction to approach 3.
Hence,

\begin{align*}\lim_{x\to\infty}f(x)=3.\end{align*}
hints: Use the limit law for quotients.

Let

\begin{align*}a=\lim_{x\to\infty} f(x).\end{align*} Then compute

\begin{align*}\lim_{x\to\infty}\frac{g(x)}{f(x)-1}.\end{align*} This is equal to 3. What can
you conclude?
